thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere sees Bournemouth as his ‘home’ and Eddie Howe would love him to stay
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere sees Bournemouth as his ‘home’ and Eddie Howe would love him to stay

author: tgannon
title: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere sees Bournemouth as his ‘home’ and Eddie Howe would love him to stay
text:
Comments EDDIE HOWE says Jack Wilshere sees Bournemouth as his “home” and would love him to stay. 
Wilshere’s future is up in the air with Arsenal unable to guarantee him first-team football and the Cherries unlikely to be able to buy him outright. Reuters 4 Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere sees Bournemouth as his ‘home’ and Eddie Howe would love him to stay 
When asked whether the 25-year-old Gunners midfielder could make his Bournemouth loan move permanent, Howe said: “We would love that to happen. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Bournemouth news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“I can’t rate Jack enough as a footballer, as a person, how he has come into the team and what he has delivered for us, but there has been no discussion with Arsenal. Reuters Jack Wilshere has found regular first-team football at Bournemouth after overcoming injury problems Reuters 4 The on-loan Arsenal midfielder has become a vital part of Eddie Howe’s system 
“As I see it, Jack is on loan for the season and then we will look at it and Jack will look at it.” 
Wilshere’s Arsenal career has been plagued by injuries. 
The England international agreed to leave the Emirates on a season-long loan in the summer in pursuit of first-team football. Related Stories Jack of no clubs Jack Wilshere faces crisis as 'Cherries unlikely to buy him and Arsenal cannot ensure first-team football' MY SUPER DUO Alex Iwobi reveals Jack Wilshere and Francis Coquelin have had the most influence on his career Wenger to walk Ian Wright believes Arsene Wenger WILL LEAVE Arsenal at the end of the season CHEEKY DOUBLE BID Monchengladbach eye Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Arsenal starlet Gedion Zelalem HOWE LONG'S HE GOT Bournemouth chairman gives Eddie Howe dreaded vote of confidence amid winless run 
He has been a regular under Howe and made 21 Premier League appearances, though is yet to score. 
Howe, who has been handed a vote of confidence after a run of poor results, believes goalless Wilshere will start to deliver more. 
He added: “Jack views this as his home at the moment and until the end of the season. Reuters 4 Eddie Howe admits he would ‘love’ to sign Jack Wilshere on a permanent deal 
“His heart has been here and from the day he walked in the door there has been no problems there. But it is his right to review his options at the end of the season and see where his career goes next. 
‘This season we have improved a lot of the aspects of our play because of him – it is always down to the team – but he has fitted into that team very well. 
“He is producing more match-defining moments, like the one against Everton, and I think there are more moments like that to come.” Jack Wilshere reveals which Arsenal player has the most magic in his feet
